edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Class PredictionTable

java.lang.Object
  edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap.PredictionTable

public class PredictionTable
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds a set of DMAP predictions. Each prediction is indexed by the first item that it is waiting to see. DMAP typically uses two of these tables, one for the fixed set of anytime predictions and one for the dynamic predictions generated each time a new item is recognized.

A prediction table is really a collection of prediction maps. Each map is indexed by the type of idex item it is using. So, all TextItems go in one table, all FrameItems go in another, and so on. The separation is used to speed indexing and allow different types of items to be indexed efficiently in different ways.

This class hides the existence of these subtables from the rest of the system.

Author:
R. James Firby

Returns:

addPrediction

public boolean addPrediction(Prediction p)
Adds a new prediction to the prediction table. It is indexed under the first item that it expects to see. The pattern in the prediction must be normalized.

Parameters:
p - The prediction to add
Returns:
Whether this prediction is okay

clearPredictions

public void clearPredictions()
Clears all predictions from this table.
